BASE SURFACES.description: Describes surface characteristics, including level or irregular topography. Differentiates between land and water surfaces.

LAND.description: Classifies land as manmade or natural. Identifies topography types: level, irregular, or steep peaks.

WATER.description: Discusses water characteristics, including land/water interfaces and ice or snow presence.

ATMOSPHERICS.description: Covers natural and manmade smells, smoke, and cloud dynamics.

STRUCTURES.description: Differentiates between surface and nonsurface structures. Identifies materials used in structures and their locations.

NATURAL OBJECTS.description: Describes natural objects both on and not on the surface.

SUBJECTS.description: Classifies subjects by gender and quantity, including focused gatherings.

MOUNTAINS.description: Identifies mountains as singular or multiple.

NONSURFACE STRUCTURES.description: Discusses characteristics of nonsurface structures, including movement and energetics.

LIGHT.description: Describes light conditions as bright, dim, or glowing.

GENERAL ENVIRONMENT.description: Classifies environments as urban, natural, or harsh.

ENERGETICS.description: Discusses types of energetics, including explosive and kinetic movements.

ACTIVITY.description: Covers activity or movement by subjects and objects.

SOUNDS.description: Describes various sounds, including talking, music, and environmental noises.

TEMPERATURES.description: Classifies temperatures as hot, moderate, or cold.

DOMINANT SESSION ELEMENTS.description: Identifies key elements in sessions, such as structures and subjects.

SKETCHES.description: Provides guidance on sketching various elements related to the target.
